reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am writing this to you as I sit in a well air conditioned, Venetian ornate decorated room here at the Becher. Mossimo (who speaks Italian, German, and English) and Anna at the front desk are the biggest asset to this hotel. Anna showed us 2 rooms at check-in and let us decide between a 3rd floor room or a 1st floor canal view room. After check-in we were given WiFi passwords, breakfast hours (breakfast is free), and scheduling for a free boat ride to the island of Murano. Breakfast has great pastries, salamies, cheeses, yogurts, fruits, and choices of juices and coffees. Hotel is centrally located in the San Marco region. Bathroom shower stall is a bit tight but clean and modernized. Beds are clean and very comfortable. Also the room has a mini fridge to store anything cold, such as waters for the next day's adventures. My wife and I love this place!
reviews.title: Excellent staff and great location
Perfect Venice
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Becher for three days from the 16th August 2012. We flew into Venice which was fantastic and then got a water taxi right to the landing of the hotel which was amazing. It was like being on a movie set. The water taxi driver played Italian music as we travelled through the canals to the hotel. The hosts at the hotel were so friendly and helpful and we felt like we were welcomed into Venice as friends and not tourists. We enjoyed our stay in the junior suite, which was a very large room with a balcony overlooking the canal. The landing is on a large canal which is a main canal on the gondoliers route. We enjoyed our Spumante, which was part of a deal in our booking, on the landing, watching the gondoliers pass by. The hotel is in a great position and it was an awesome experience staying here. The young man at the desk (regretfully we are not aware of his name) is so friendly and a great asset to the hotel. On our last day he made sure we had breakfast in the landing, which was very considerate. I hope the staff and hotel enjoy the success they deserve!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have nothing bad to say, the staff was really cool and wishing to help, they told us about the free hotel boat taxi to murano (you have to go there), the rooms are a little bit old but neat, well decorated and confortable. The breakfast was great.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL AND STAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great stay at this amazing and well located hotel. The hotel staff is quite nice explaining and helping you out during your stay, worth mentioning also the breakfast with good food and possibility of having it just in the venice channel, not too bad!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: This hotel is a little difficult to find but like most of Venice, everything is hard to find! Massemo helped recommended the best little "local" restaurant which turned out to be outstanding!! The room was a bit small but really, who cares... it's not like we stayed in our hotel very much! Most of the time was outside siteseeing and we only was in our room to sleep. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Small but service excellent!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very small boutique hotel, probably the smallest I ever stayed in. However, it was great. Our room was on a second floor overlooking a canal which was awesome. The room itself was ok, nothing special, but it served us well for the 2 nights we spent exploring and enjoying Venice. The breakfast served was nice (although the dining room was so tiny that we felt a little cramped with just another family there), well, something that comes with a boutique hotel, I guess. The hotel location was great - a short, 10-minute walk to St. Mark's Square through a maze of unique narrow venetian streets - an adventure on its own! The hotel staff was very helpful and they gave us great, easy directions to the square. Word of caution - do not deviate from the directions, it's so easy to get lost in Venice . What seems like a paralel street most probably is not, so even with the keenest sense of direction, you'll risk getting lost with one wrong turn.
reviews.title: Great location!
Very Nice!
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights post-cruise.
Very centrally located and (reasonably) easy to find.
reviews.title: Great hotel and great staff !!!!

reviews.text: We got upgraded to a room with 2 bathrooms.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with great staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely little balcony at the water entrance. You can have your breakfast there or just relax in the evening (which we did) and watch the gondolas go by -- kinda like having your own private little water parade.
reviews.title: Romantic Stay in Venice

reviews.text: This is a lovely hotel to stay in, beautiful decor wonderful staff, spotlessly clean, all you could ask for. We are fussy travelers and have stayed in some lovely hotels world wide and this rates amongst the very best. Thanks to Anna and the lovely staff for making our stay so memorable. Venice is a wonderful place to visit.
reviews.title: Fussy travelers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reviews of this hotel are accurate! It is wonderful! We stayed for three nights. Our room was very small but this is Venice and it is an older building. The hotel staff is very nice and accommodating, Anna was especially warm and friendly upon our arrival! The staff booked us a water taxi to the train station and gave us several restaurant recommendations. All of which were very good. This hotel is very charming. It's also very reasonably priced. The services and the hotel exceeded my expectations. I would recommend taking a water taxi to and from the airport or train station. The dock is accessible to taxi's and lugging your luggage around Venice seems very difficult!
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel.
Quit searching and STAY HERE! Quick, book canal room!
reviews.text: What an amazing hotel! We, my new fiancee and I!, traveled Europe and stayed in a lot of hotels, this was by far the best! Pay the extra for the canal view, it was one of our best memories from the trip! Sitting at the window watching gondolas go by, laying in bed listening to them sing in the morning! Ahhhh, Venice, you are amazing! This hotel was THE best location in Venice. In all the twists and tangles of the streets, it was great to have a hotel easy to find because it was pretty close to st. Marks. So if ever lost, follow signs to st. Marks and then you can find your way back! We did lots of hotel research and it paid off! Hardly ever would I want to go back to the same hotel on a vacation, I like to experience different places. But in this case, I would stay here over and over, if ever we find ourselves lucky enough to be in Venice again. Oh, and it was hot hot hot outside, so the cool air conditioning was such a retreat! One night we bought a bottle of Bellini and sat out on the hotels landing on the canal. So romantic! Nice staff too, we arrived way early from our overnight train. They said they would hold our bags, but I felt so gross after the heat and sleeping on the train. Checkin wasnt for another several hours. They let me use the bathroom to wash up a bit, but then thankfully told us our room was ready. I was so thankful that they let us checkin so early! If you are reading this I am jealous, because 1, you must be going to Venice soon, and 2, you are booking hotel Becher now! You will love it! Venice was our absolute favorite city topping london, paris, and munich. Trust me, stay here! Happy travels!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a hidden gem. Beautiful rooms! We stayed in the little suite with balcony over the canal, and it was incredibly romantic for our second honeymoon. It was our first time to Venice.
reviews.title: Such nice staff!

reviews.text: The staff at the front desk were extremely helpful and friendly and made everything so easy for us; from finding a place for lunch AND dinner, (which were excellent) to organizing a taxi and looking up train schedules for our departure. They let us keep our luggage there until we left the city, and the taxi picked us up on the doorstep. What an experience! The taxi ride was as fun as the gondola ride we'd had earlier!
reviews.title: Wonderful view from our balcony made it difficult to leave our room!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in April 2010. Got a good deal on an excellent room with balcony overlooking the canal.
reviews.title: Perfect Venetian Hotel

reviews.text: Staff were so friendly and had our room ready as requested as we had arrived early. A really huge room by Venetian standards as far as i know and really luxuriously decorated.
reviews.title: A Very Special place..

reviews.text: Could not think of one bad comment about the Becher..perfectly clean, lovely breakfast and excellent location only a few streets from St Marks.
reviews.title: Nice clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Venice is just an amazingly surreal city and this hotel is a perfect place to start your adventures along the little streets from :)
reviews.title: Enchanting Stay In Venice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh, as previous reviewers stated it is a little distance from the nearest Vaporetto stop, so make sure your luggage has wheels!!
reviews.title: A fabulous little gem in the heart of Venice
